Items.Title: Kampong Chill
Items.Content:
Kampong Chill transcends a mere art installation; it's a profound, gentle rebellion against the relentless tyranny of schedules and the pervasive cult of "busy-ness." This satirical piece champions inefficiency as an art form, elevates daydreaming to a cultural practice, and frames sitting still as a revolutionary act.

It invites visitors to arrive without agenda and rest without guilt, using materials such as bamboo as a metaphor for brevity, to deconstruct myths that equate rest with laziness, slowness with failure, or wonder with wasted time. In the intense urban heart of Singapore, Kampong Chill offers a much-needed sanctuary for every citizen, migrant, and traveler: a place to pause, breathe, and rediscover oneself while remembering that everything is temporary and will eventually pass; so why not embrace the art of being truly present? Welcome to Kampong Chill!


Drop-in Activities:

                 

About Yok & Sheryo
Yok & Sheryo are an interdisciplinary artist duo who create irreverent mixed-media works centered around "Yeahnahnesia," a tropical island mythology. They blend cultural syncretism in paintings, murals, and sculptures that comment on modern society and its mercurial nature. Having painted over 600 murals worldwide, their work has been featured in movies and exhibited internationally at venues like ArtScience Museum Singapore, Art Gallery of Western Australia, Wynwood Walls, and Coney Island Art Walls, with features in publications including Juxtapoz, HypeBeast, Time Magazine and Complex.

Items.Title: Sky Castle
Items.Content:
Sky Castle by ENESS is an enchanting, interactive sound and light installation, transforming public spaces with its vibrant cluster of inflatable arches that form a colourful symphony. As visitors navigate through these arches, their movements directly power and advance a melodic xylophone soundscape, simultaneously triggering captivating colour changes within each arch. 

The intricate orchestration of light, colour, and music is designed to evoke the pure joy and profound hope symbolised by rainbows emerging after a storm. As more people join this immersive journey, the contemporary musical score crescendos in intensity, creating a unique, lush orchestral piece that dynamically responds to crowd flow and fluctuations, ensuring a different experience every night. Visitors can also look forward to other fun activities* like inflatable costumes, cotton candy, stick on tattoos, and more.

Purchase tickets on Vouch or Klook.

*Additional charges apply.

About ENESS
Founded in 1997, ENESS is a multi-award-winning art and technology studio. The team produces temporary and permanent interactive public art combining various disciplines including sculpture, textiles, design, programming, music, and story. At the heart of all ENESS work is cross-generational connection. Pioneers of new media art, the collective's ethos is a belief in the power of art to fire the imagination; providing joy and happiness in unexpected places – transformational experiences that change lives.

Social Media
IG: @studioeness
Website: eness.com


Special Thanks

Items.Title: CYBERSWORDFISH V2.0
Items.Content:
Inspired by the ancient legend of Singapura Dilanggar Todak, CYBERSWORDFISH V2.0: From Myth to Megabytes presents a striking sculpture that reimagines the invading swordfish as formidable cyberpunk creatures. These modern-day mythical beings are meticulously crafted from e-waste: composed of cracked screens, frayed wires, and salvaged digital components.

As artificial intelligence rapidly accelerates and our societal appetite for new devices intensifies, this compelling installation prompts critical reflection: what becomes of the technological debris we inevitably leave behind? CYBERSWORDFISH V2.0: From Myth to Megabytes masterfully fuses traditional folklore with speculative futures, compelling viewers to reconsider consumption patterns, waste management, and the imperative of renewal in an era defined by relentless technological turnover. In a city globally renowned for its innovation, the artwork poses a crucial question: can Singapore also lead the way in environmental responsibility?

All E-waste used in CYBERSWORDFISH V2.0 was contributed by ALBA E-Waste, supporting sustainable art and giving old tech a cool new life. Visit www.alba-ewaste.sg to find out more.


About Yang Derong
Yang Derong is a multidisciplinary Singaporean artist, fashion designer, and creative director whose work spans fashion, theatre, large-scale events, and visual art. Known for blending tradition with innovation, Yang brings a truly local POV to reflect on the complexities of today’s world. From Face of the Day to DIGikat, his works explore identity, community, and transformation through storytelling that merges digital expression with cultural memory and handcrafted artistry.

Social Media

Items.Title: Jiwa Laut
Items.Content:
Jiwa Laut is an evocative artwork drawing deeply from Southeast Asian crab folklore and rich coastal heritage. Its primary aim is to forge a renewed connection between urban audiences and their often-forgotten marine past.

The piece features luminous crab sculptures, designed to mimic the gentle movement of small boats navigating a shoreline. This visual metaphor creates a profound and poetic link to the sea, serving as a powerful reminder. It underscores that even coastlines seemingly remote from bustling city life continue to hold deep emotional resonance, brimming with untold stories, cherished memories, and the timeless, enduring rhythms of the ocean waves.

About Koh Kai Ting and Aw Boon Xin
Koh Kai Ting and Aw Boon Xin are co-founders of 2point013, an art-tech collective exploring worldbuilding, XR, and marine heritage. Their practice merges ecology, heritage, and immersive media to question dominant knowledge systems. They have exhibited locally and internationally, including at Art Jog and Georgetown Festival. Based between Singapore and Malaysia, they work closely with communities through storytelling, speculative archives, and experimental digital forms that blur the lines between art, technology, and lived experience.

Social Media
Aw Boon Xin's IG: @2point013
Koh Kai Ting's IG: @kaitkkt

Items.Title: KU a Dreamer
Items.Content:
In the relentless pace of modern life, the artwork KU a Dreamer prompts a vital question: do we still make time for dreaming? Amidst the constant demands of work, meticulous plans, and endless obligations, it's easy to lose sight of our personal aspirations. KU, however, offers a refreshing counterpoint. He is depicted at rest, carefully enclosing his dreams in a box and contemplating them. While the world rushes by, KU invites us to pause, observe our surroundings, and release our anxieties. 

Join this dreamy, innocent boy, KU, to find a moment of respite, recharge your spirit, and rekindle your own dreams.

About Tùng Monkey
Tùng Monkey, also known as Le Thanh Tung, is a Vietnamese visual artist and creative director with over 15 years of experience in the field. He's known for his innovative and experimental approach to art, particularly in combining digital illustration, real-time computer graphics, and other high-tech tools like AR/VR, 3D printing, and AI. He's also a VJ, whose visual performances have taken him to various events and exhibitions worldwide. 

Social Media
IG @tungcrazymonkey 
FB: facebook.com/crazymonkeyvisual/ 
Website: crazymonkey.vn

Venue.Address: Funan Level 1 Kinetic Wall (Coleman Street entrance)

Items.Title: Skygazers: Dreaming into the Past and Future
Items.Content:
Skygazers explores our connection to the cosmos and culture through an interactive light installation. Inspired by an archival photograph of four nyonyas, the artwork features a face gazing skyward, adorned with distinctive Peranakan patterns and motifs. Its three-layered structure of translucent acrylic panels and metal frames invites visitors to walk between layers and experience different perspectives of the face. This synthesis of traditional patterns and contemporary form invites reflection on heritage and aspiration. It connects our ancestral roots with dreams of the future, offering a space for hope and contemplation.

 

About Space Objekt x Reza Hasni

Space Objekt x Reza Hasni’s collaborative work features immersive, large-scale installations and public art for festivals and events worldwide. Space Objekt, founded by Tina Fung and Ash Razaque, is a design studio dedicated to reimagining spatial experiences. Reza Hasni is an artist known for creating transcendental realities through illustration and motion graphics. Their past projects include commissions for the Malay Heritage Centre, Summerwell Festival (Bucharest, Romania), Life is Beautiful (Las Vegas, USA), and Singapore Art Week

 

Social Media
IG: @space.objekt | @reza.hasni
FB: facebook.com/SpaceObjekt | facebook.com/rezahasne
Website: www.spaceobjekt.com | www.rezahasni.net

Items.Title: The Garden of Stories
Items.Content:
The third installation, The Garden of Stories by artist Yang Jie, is a kinetic sound installation made up of interactive sculptures crafted from everyday objects of kampung life in 1950s–60s Singapore. Featuring items like rubber seed charms, balancing scales and red wooden clogs, these mechanical vignettes come to life with movement and sound as visitors approach, evoking memories of the past. Set among trees in a plantation-like arrangement just outside Stamford Arts Centre, the installation invites audiences to wander, reflect, and connect with fragments of Singapore’s shared heritage through motion, sound, and storytelling.

 

About Yang Jie
 Yang Jie is a sculptor who draws inspiration from the intricate world of objects. From familiar household objects to industrial machines, he is fascinated by how things are made and used, excavating stories and ideas from found objects and machines through the traces of use. Using his background in electronics engineering and sculpture, he reinterprets the human experience through mechanical movements and electronics, transforming repaired and found objects into kinetic sculptures that perform. At the core of his exploration lies a fascination with how objects crafted by human hands of ten take on new and unexpected meanings beyond their original intentions.

 

Social Media
IG: @yj.sg

Items.Title: Two Sides of Our Island
Items.Content:
Two Sides of Our Island stands as a heartfelt tribute to Singapore's dynamic and ever-evolving spirit. A city-island defined by its rich contrasts and deep-seated memories. Employing a unique blend of intricate illustration and clever optical illusions, this artwork draws viewers into a multi-layered experience. It masterfully evokes a sense of nostalgia while simultaneously revealing familiar Singaporean elements in delightfully unexpected ways.

The installation further enhances engagement with three interactive photo spots: an immersive infinity room featuring a "selfie" mirror, a vibrant illustrative backdrop, and a serene seating area encircled by floating islands, all complemented by a custom scent for a truly multi-sensory and reflective journey.

About LABSIXFIVE
Founded by Ben Qwek in 2019, LABSIXFIVE is a humble studio with big dreams based in Singapore. Through creative direction, graphic design and illustration, they work with agencies and clients across the globe to deliver compelling designs for both digital and physical platforms. LABSIXFIVE is also the go to Singapore studio for 3D anamorphic art with up to 200+ artworks worldwide under their belt.

Social Media
IG: @labsixfive | @benqwek
Website: labsixfive.com

Items.Title: UTOPIA
Items.Content:
UTOPIA, an immersive video installation by Loh transports viewers 600 years into the future, envisioning Bugis as a vibrant, cosmopolitan island spaceport. At its heart, two spacemen engage in a serene zero-gravity tea ceremony, semi-submerged in the bay. Their suits are not merely protective gear but carriers of fragmented language and echoes of ancestral appetites. 

Here, food transcends its form, becoming the ultimate cultural adhesive, with futuristic renditions of iconic dishes like nasi lemak and laksa. Each flavour acts as a profound timestamp and a chant of memory. The visuals loop hypnotically, celebrating Singapore's intricate hybrid identities and rich culinary cosmologies. This "Island Utopia" invites a layered experience of culture and boundless possibility, asserting Singapore's enduring essence.

About Jahan Loh
Jahan Loh is a Singaporean contemporary artist and curator known for his distinctive fusion of street art, pop culture and Eastern iconography. With a career spanning over two decades, Loh has established himself as a leading figure in the Asian art scene, captivating audiences all over the continent with his dynamic and thought-provoking works. As the first artist to bring street art to galleries in both Singapore and China, Jahan has been credited as one of Asia's most successful street artists, for taking Singapore Pop Art international, and for influencing modern art practices in Taiwan.

Social Media
IG: @jahan_

Items.Title: Waves of Time: Splash On Our Skyline
Items.Content:
This retro-futuristic installation serves as a vibrant homage to Singapore's profound maritime history, strategically placed within the historical Bugis and Beach Road precinct. Its design incorporates a prominent wave motif, symbolising the nation's continuous pursuit of metropolitan greatness and the dynamic ebb and flow of its progress.

Complementing this, neon lighting, a heritage medium once emblematic of modernity and advancement, is thoughtfully utilised to evoke a past era. The convergence of these distinct historical threads - maritime heritage, national ambition, and nostalgic neon - culminates in a bold artistic statement, inviting viewers to reflect on the city's journey and its powerful return to its roots.

About maegzter
An artist in both heart and practice, Megan explores new ways to portray the timeless craft of neon; blending tradition and innovation. Driven by a passion to preserve and elevate this classic medium, she uses neon to express her artistic vision and capture the dynamic energy of Singapore. 

Social Media
IG: @maegzter
TT: @maegzter

Items.Title: ALIGHT Across the SEA
Items.Content:
ALIGHT Across the SEA is a collaborative projection mapping artwork marking the inaugural edition of the ALIGHT Network Conference. Many hands make light work, the mapping comprises an astounding medley of works by some of the brightest minds such as international artists Abdul Shakir (Malaysia), Isaiah Cacnio (Philippines), Sembilan Matahari (Indonesia), The Fox, The Folks (Indonesia) and local artist Chris Chai (Cosmicchai). 

Marking a first-ever for the Singapore Night Festival, visitors can treat themselves to this spectacle at Waterloo Centre and come face to face with the beautiful representation of the collective and creative possibilities from the Conference. Akin to rays of light beaming across our shared seascape and converging onto a single beacon, this artwork serves as a cordial welcome to all.

 

About the Artists

Abdul Shakir
Co-organiser of ALIGHT Conference | TERANG Projection Mapping Competition (Malaysia)

Abdul Shakir (Grasshopper) is one of the co-founder of Filamen a new media art collective focusing on projection mapping, light installation and interactive installation. He works with a few post and production agencies with work range from graphic design, motion graphics to projection mapping and interactive installation projects in several countries such as China, Hong Kong, Spain, USA and of course Malaysia. With several years of agency experience, he founded Filamen to bring new media artist together and create an awareness about its industry to the masses.
 
Chris Chai (Cosmicchai)
Visual Artist (Singapore)

Chris Chai is a muralist, illustrator and artist whose visual practice can be summarised into one essential idea - the exploration of human complexity thought repetition of line and form. His work draws from the multitude of organised structures that constantly surround us, from architecture, to biology, social networks and modern and ancient belief systems, in an attempt to examine the relationship between order and chaos and reach an intimate understanding of balance.

Isaiah Cacnio
Digital and Fine Art Artist (Philippines)

Isaiah Cacnio is a Manila-based motion graphics artist whose immersive works blend light, movement, and space to explore digital art, nature, and science. His sold-out 2025 solo debut The Language of Infinity at Art Fair Philippines featured Life Unfolding, merging metal prints and projection mapping. One of the first digital artists to solo exhibit at the National Museum of the Philippines, he expands how new media is experienced in traditional spaces.
 
Adi Panuntun
Co-Founder of Sembilan Matahari (Indonesia)
 
Adi Panuntun is the co-founder of Sembilan Matahari, Chairman of BCCF, and co-founder of Nirmana Kinetic. He is known for video mapping works at landmarks like Fatahillah Museum, Gedung Sate, and Prambanan Temple. His debut film Cin(T)a won a Citra Award in 2009. Adi has won top prizes in Japan, Russia, and Germany. Through BCCF, he helped Bandung join the UNESCO Creative Cities Network and initiated local policies to strengthen the creative ecosystem

Fadjar Kurnia
The Fox, The Folks (Indonesia)

Fadjar Kurnia is Creative Director and founder of The Fox, The Folks, a Bandung-based multimedia art team specialising in animation-driven projection mapping that fuses cultural narratives with contemporary aesthetics. His work has won global accolades, including Tokyo’s 1 Minute Projection Mapping Competition (2021), Schlosslichtspiele Karlsruhe (2022), LUNAR Festival Sofia (2024), and Genius Loci Weimar (2025). Under his direction, the studio pushes the boundaries of light, colour, and narrative in public space.
Items.Artist: Abdul Shakir, Chris Chai, Isaiah Cacnio, Sembilan Matahari, and The Fox, The Folks

Items.Title: Awakening
Items.Content:
Awakening delves into Singapore's unique island history, sparked by an epiphany and a metaphorical dive into a shipwreck. The artwork explores the folkloric dimensions of this little island nation, examining the significant role of its port — a destiny foisted upon it by historical currents. More profoundly, Awakening serves as a heartfelt celebration of the diverse people and vibrant cultures that have been drawn to Singapore's shores by the unstoppable tides of trade. It's a contemplative piece that reflects on the past to illuminate the present identity, emphasising the intricate tapestry woven by human movement and commercial exchange.

 

About Tororo.aoi
Asher Yeo also known as Tororo.aoi is a freelance illustrator, tattoo artist, writer and mythology nerd based in Singapore. 

A lover of eyes, impossible biology and tales of metamorphosis and transformation. Ash is inspired by the stories people tell and the way these stories continue to be held in the consciousness of a people, specializing in intricate, surreal, lined pieces. 

 

Social Media
IG: @tororo.aoi
FB: facebook.com/Tororo.aoi/

Items.Title: Dari Pulau Ke Pulau (From One Island to Another)
Items.Content:
Dari Pulau Ke Pulau (From One Island to Another) is a deeply personal exploration of migration, tracing the remarkable journeys of the artist's maternal and paternal grandparents. The narrative follows their respective odysseys from Alor Gajah, Melaka, and Pacitan, East Java, ultimately leading them to Singapore.

Rooted in rich family history and ancestral memory, preserved through cherished oral storytelling and treasured heirlooms, this work constructs a compelling visual narrative. Through a combination of illustration and moving images, it vividly reimagines the routes taken by these ancestors, mapping not only the geographical landscapes they traversed but also the profound emotional experiences that shaped their arrival in Singapore.

 

About HAFI

HAFI is an illustrator, designer and visual artist.

She makes visual interpretations through drawings that are rooted in ancestral memories. Her works dissect themes of identity and cultural narratives via image making.

 

Social Media
IG: @hahahafi
Website: hahahafi.com

Items.Title: Island Waters
Items.Content:
Island Waters invites viewers on an immersive exploration of underwater realms, highlighting the profound connections between human life and our oceans. The journey begins with a simple ripple, then plunges into the seabed's depths, ascends through bustling maritime pathways, and finally resurfaces. Inspired by the vibrant hues of Peranakan porcelain, this artwork celebrates the rich diversity of local marine flora and fauna. It also emphasises the dynamic interconnectivity inherent in island life, weaving together threads from the past, present, and future, showcasing the vital role of water in our shared existence and cultural heritage.

About KangLi
KangLi is an illustrator and motion designer from Singapore. She specialises in bold, graphic shapes and colourful designs. Her work is inspired by taking a playful and humorous spin on the everyday. She uses exaggerated forms and a host of expressive characters to bring life to her illustrations.

Social Media
IG: @lim_kangli
Website: limkangli.net

Items.Title: MOSAIC
Items.Content:
MOSAIC marries video mapping and music in an immersive spectacle, covering themes of astronomical phenomena, navigation, and travel through islands. Viewers will go on a stellar journey, weaving in between constellations and old-world cartographies to revisit the epic voyages in the region. 

Known for its rich architectural heritage, the National Museum of Singapore serves as the ideal backdrop. The projection mapping incorporates elements of Kebaya and Batik, reflecting the brilliant cultural heritage and the flow of these textiles across the region.

About Jérémie Bellot & Ena Eno
Jérémie Bellot, trained as an artist and architect, designs and creates architectural, visual, lighting and sound installations. His work explores the role of light in both lived and perceived space, through immersive audiovisual devices. Nurtured by polyhedral geometry and the mathematical arts, he offers a new perception of space while questioning our relationship with architectural and natural heritage.

Ena Eno is a composer, musician and sound artist. His artistic commitment focuses on acousmatic music, and his work revolves around multimedia projects that place the notion of space and immersion at the heart of his proccess.

Items.Title: Roadside beauties and healing remedies
Items.Content:
Roadside beauties and healing remedies illuminates a fascinating aspect of traditional healing: the creation of cooling tea recipes from common roadside beauties - wildflowers and herbs native to Southeast Asia and the broader Asian continent. Especially relevant given island living and the recent escalating heat, the piece playfully highlights the medicinal benefits of these often-overlooked ingredients. It serves as a vital reminder for us to embrace our role as custodians of ancestral wisdom and knowledge passed down through generations. 

The work extends the artist's focus, initiated during the COVID-19 pandemic, into addressing the pressing concerns of our contemporary climate emergency, advocating for sustainable solutions.

About Adeline Kueh
Adeline Kueh makes installations and socially embodied works that reconsider our relationships with objects and rituals. Using drawing as a conceptual tool, she maps historical trajectories with craft and oral tradition. As a co-founder of the Critical Craft Collective (Singapore) and the pan-Borneo Serumpun Collective, her artistic and curatorial research examines the entanglement of the elements of craft and the politics of care. A Senior Lecturer with LASALLE’s MA Fine Arts programme, Adeline has exhibited internationally, including World Architecture Festival, Venice Biennale, Hermes, NTU CCA IdeasFest, and Asia NOW. She is a 2024-2026 Ewha Womans University’s Global Fellow.

Social Media
IG: @lulu_enpassant
Website: adelinekueh.com

Items.Title: "Island Beats" Open Mic Music Nights & ibis Music Nights
Items.Content:
The rhythm of Southeast Asia goes hard at "Island Beats" Open Mic Music Nights and ibis Music Nights at ibis Singapore on Bencoolen.  

Dive right into vibrant live performances that spotlight diverse musical traditions and contemporary sounds of Southeast Asian cultures.

From soulful acoustic acts to upbeat ethnic fusion, every night features passionate artists and cultural expression in an intimate setting. Whether you're a performer or a music lover, you're in for nights of community, rhythm, and discovery — right in the heart of the Singapore Night Festival. Come for the music, stay for the vibe.

ibis Music Nights (8pm - 10pm)

  • Wednesday: 27 Aug & 3 Sep
  • Friday: 22, 29 Aug & 5 Sep 

"Island Beats" Open Mic Music Nights (8pm - 10pm)

ibis Singapore on Bencoolen – Award-Winning Comfort in the Heart of Singapore

Located in the vibrant Bugis district, ibis Singapore on Bencoolen offers a seamless blend of comfort, convenience, and sustainability. Enjoy newly refurbished rooms, high-speed Wi-Fi, and eco-friendly amenities. With excellent connectivity to MRT stations and top attractions, plus 24/7 dining options, our award-winning hotel is the perfect choice for business and leisure travellers seeking affordability without compromise.

Items.Title: Nila’s Shimmering Shores – An Immersive Story Room Adventure
Items.Content:
Step into the heart of Island Nights at Singapore Night Festival with this ticketed sensory experience.

As night falls, journey to a shimmering island where the sea whispers and legends rise. 

Enter a reimagined tale of Sang Nila Utama in the inclusive Story Room Adventure—an immersive experience thoughtfully designed with neurodiverse children in mind. Through sound, texture, movement, and play, children and grown-ups will encounter the golden deer, the lion, and the mighty storm.

Blending storytelling, installation, and craft, this magical encounter invites all to explore, imagine, and rediscover wonder together beneath the enchanting glow of Island Nights.

About Children's Museum Singapore
Let’s “Start with Wonder” at Children’s Museum Singapore. Children’s Museum Singapore is the first museum in Singapore dedicated to children 12 years old and below. It serves as a ‘starter museum’ to introduce young visitors and their families to the museum-going experience and facilitate a conducive environment for learning through play. 

Social Media
IG: @ilovecmsg
FB: facebook.com/childrensmuseumsingapore
Website: heritage.sg/childrensmuseum
Items.Dates: 22 Aug & 23 Aug, 29 Aug & 30 Aug, 05 Sep & 06 Sep

Items.Title: Partial Eclipse Of The Heart 《逆光》
Items.Content:
Every decade at the same seaside chalet, five friends gather beneath the shadow of an eclipse, marking the ever-changing tides of their lives…

One minute, you’re a reckless teenager with big dreams; the next, you’re a “responsible” grown-up wondering how everything got so complicated. First loves, epic fails, questionable decisions… Who said growing pains stop at adulthood?!

But aiya, we'll figure it out together! Life’s tempo may shift, but some melodies stay on repeat.

A heartwarmingly irreverent celebration of our nation’s journey, told through the songs that defined us; the hotly-anticipated jukebox musical features Mandopop hits from Tan Kah Beng, Jimmy Ye, Lee Shih Shiong, Lee Wei Shiong, Stephanie Sun, Xiaohan, Eric Ng, Tanya Chua and more — plus a brand-new musical number by Xiaohan and Julian Wong.

Starring Joanna Dong, Derrick Hoh, Ric Liu, Jean Seizure and Chriz Tong. Directed by Kuo Jian Hong (Lao Jiu: The Musical, If There’re Seasons…), with story by Jonathan Lim and Practice Associate Artist Ng Mun Poh.

 

About The Theatre Practice

The Theatre Practice (Practice) is Singapore’s longest-standing professional bilingual theatre institution. Artist-driven and deeply progressive, Practice strives to be an arts space in Singapore that consciously nurtures and empowers people who care about humanity. Over the past 58 years, we have developed and presented works that aim to reflect the richness and complexities of Singapore’s diverse cultures. Artistically diverse and constantly relevant, Practice will always engage in the ceaseless exploration of new frontiers. 

 

Social Media

IG: @thetheatrepractice
FB: facebook.com/thetheatrepractice/
Website: practice.org.sg/

Venue.Value: Drama Centre Theatre (National Library Building Level 3)
Venue.Address: Drama Centre Theatre (National Library Building Level 3)

Items.Title: The Island Dreamer - A Wander-Wonder Experience
Items.Content:
The Island Dreamer by Starlight Alchemy is a roving performance that bends light with movement arts and storytelling. This experiential spectacle unfolds across the night, revealing characters born of legends, memory, and the elements.

Viewers are invited to journey alongside the Dreamer through realms of water, earth, and air with each act unveiling hypnotic expressions, glowing props, and vibrant visual magic. Presented across multiple venues, “The Island Dreamer“ uniquely reimagines Singapore’s island heritage through imagery and myth.

Let the tides guide you, the land ground you, and the sky awaken you - join us in a tale through the elements as the Dreamer drifts between worlds on a luminous island night. 

About Starlight Alchemy
Starlight Alchemy is Singapore’s leading experiential movement arts company with 20+ years of show design expertise. Trusted by collaborators and clients for brand activations, immersive storytelling, and stunning visual artistry, we are a multidisciplinary collective of performers, creatives, and innovators. Rooted in collaborative creation, we craft transformative performances that awaken the senses and ignite imagination—from the surreal and sublime to the epic and orchestral.

Website: starlightalchemy.com

Items.Title: Performance by Pocket Pugs and SOTA Pop/Jazz
Items.Content:
The SOTA Pop/Jazz band. Pocket Pugs. Two bands of young, enthusiastic musicians who enjoy playing music from a range of genres. The Pop/Jazz band practices under the guidance of mentor Kerong Chok, delivering quality performances for all. Pocket Pugs features students from different art forms unified by music to put forth electrifying performances. Support the young artists from both bands and enjoy an exciting lineup of songs for all ages!

 

About School of the Arts (SOTA)

SOTA is Singapore’s specialised independent school for students aged 13-18, offering a six-year arts and academic curriculum, leading to the International Baccalaureate Diploma Programme (IBDP) or the International Baccalaureate Career-Related Programme (IBCP). The school offers students the opportunity to focus and hone their skills in their various art forms and allows them to pursue their passions actively. 

Social Media
IG:  @sotasg
Website: sota.edu.sg

Venue.Address: School of the Arts (At the steps of SOTA)

Items.Title: A River Reborn
Items.Content:
This transformed walkway captures the spirit of Sungei Beras Bassa, a river that once ran through the precinct - bringing Singapore’s flora and fauna to life. Inspired by the calm spots where communities once gathered to rest, reflect, and connect, the installation invites you to slow down and immerse yourself in a space where history flows beneath your feet. Step into the precinct’s memory - a simple path turned into a sensory journey through time.

 

About National Day Activations

HeritageSG is proud to present the annual National Day Activations (NDAV), a national placemaking initiative held in the Bras Basah.Bugis (BBB) arts and heritage district. The NDAV is also held in conjunction with the Singapore Night Festival (SNF) 2025, to commemorate our nation's 60th birthday. Watch the precinct come to life through projections on historical buildings and activations at hidden spaces within BBB.

This year’s NDAV, Celebrating Our Island, celebrates 60 years of Singapore’s rich history – from food and nature to places and culture - and also pays tribute to the Singapore Night Festival. Aligned with this year’s festival theme, Island Nights, the activations will also highlight Sungei Beras Bassa, a historic river that once flowed through the plantations in the BBB precinct.

Experience BBB’s storied past from 1 Aug – 6 Sep 2025 through seven light activations at landmarks such as the National Museum of Singapore (1 – 9 Aug), Reflection Pool @ Bras Basah MRT Station, Fortune Centre's digital billboard, Stamford Walkway, St. Joseph’s Church, Ten Square's digital billboard and The Cathay.

Items.Title: Fortune Food Paradise
Items.Content:
A special SG60 collaboration between Bras Basah.Bugis and Nanyang Academy of Fine Arts (NAFA) Faculty of Art & Design.

Discover the emotional power of food and memory through two animated short films created by NAFA students. Titled Fortune Food Paradise, the work celebrates Singapore's food culture and Fortune Centre's role as a food paradise in the BBB precinct.

The first animation journeys into childhood days, where local dishes evoke heartfelt moments shared with loved ones. The second video explores how these comforting flavours evolve into modern fusion creations – new food experiences that continue to bring loved ones together.

Inspired by The Cathay Gallery on Level 2, this activation of lights honours the rich cinematic legacy with a treasure trove of insights into the beginnings of film and movies in Singapore. Think floating film stars, retro cinema vibes, and stories from Singapore’s golden age of film – all in one spot!

Items.Title: Lepak by the River
Items.Content:
Tune in to the rhythm of slow island living and gentle flows of the water above Reflection Pool @ Bras Basah MRT Station - a modern-day oasis inspired by the historic Sungei Beras Bassa. This fountain-like space reimagines the rivers and coasts where communities once gathered to rest, connect, and reflect. Whether you're looking to relax, chat with friends or just enjoy the calming sound of water, this is your invitation to pause and enjoy the simple pleasures of urban life.

Items.Title: Paradise of Play
Items.Content:
A special SG60 collaboration between Bras Basah.Bugis, Ten Square and LASALLE College of the Arts students from the Puttnam School of Film & Animation.

Two anamorphic animations created by LASALLE students light up the Ten Square Digital Billboard, celebrating local youth culture. Titled Paradise of Play, the work pays homage to the vibrant Selegie Youth Scene, a hotspot of youth energy and surrounded by arts institutions.
 
Watch as playful mascots explores the vibrant Selegie Youth Scene — from café hopping to claw machine fun! It spotlights how heritage and creativity are often intertwined in Bras Basah.Bugis – a district shaped by play, innovation, collaboration and culture.

Items.Title: Songs of Nutmeg Trees
Items.Content:
Experience a luminous tribute to the various plantations that once thrived along the banks of Sungei Beras Bassa. This light projection delicately casts the silhouettes of nutmeg trees onto the church façade, echoing a time when these fragrant groves lined Victoria Street - where the river once flowed, nourishing the land and its legacy. Through shifting visuals and playful lights, this piece evokes a time when these fragrant trees shaped the area's landscape and economy. 

Can you catch that warm, fragrant hint of nutmeg in the air?

Items.Title: A Date with Tradition 2025
Items.Content:
Experience three exciting weekends of cultural discovery at A Date With Tradition 2025. Dive into hands-on workshops, captivating performances, drop-in activities, and interactive art installations - all celebrating Singapore’s rich and diverse heritage. Held at Stamford Arts Centre, this cultural festival invites you to connect with traditional arts in fresh and engaging ways. Forge meaningful connections and memories with us as we celebrate our heritage together!

Items.Title: All Things Singapore (AT SG) 2025
Items.Content:
All Things Singapore (AT SG) 2025 invites you to dive into the enchanting world of Singapore’s islands. Experience dynamic performances that reimagine island life, interactive installations that celebrate nature and island communities, and insightful programmes that uncover rich stories and legacies. Journey through our islands’ vibrant spirit with a unique blend of arts, history and creativity at the National Library and National Archives of Singapore. So, join us for All Things Singapore 2025, where heritage, arts and culture come alive after dark.

Discover more at go.gov.sg/atsg2025.

 

About National Library Board
The National Library Board (NLB) nurtures Readers for Life, Learning Communities and a Knowledgeable Nation by promoting reading, learning and history through its network of 28 libraries, the National Library and the National Archives of Singapore. NLB also forges strategic partnerships that encourage awareness, appreciation and greater discovery of Singapore's history through its rich collections in Singapore and the region. 

NLB achieves excellence through innovation, focusing on citizen engagement and creation, resource and digital innovation. This creates learning opportunities, greater access to library resources, services, and archival collections, as well as a continual development of innovative library spaces. Established on 1 September 1995 as a statutory board, NLB is under the Ministry of Digital Development and information.

Items.Title: Bugis Night Lights
Items.Content:
Join Bugis Town for Bugis Night Lights, back for its fourth spectacular year! Enjoy two months of vibrant events, dynamic activations, and irresistible rewards.

Relive your school-day glory at our NAPFA-themed 2.4km fun run with JD Sports, and unleash your inner kid at TEVA’s Let’s Go Play Lah pop-up inspired by iconic playgrounds. Experience immersive neon art installation by neon artist, Megan (@maegzter) at Bugis+ and explore Retro District, a mini festival village by Resurrack for Singapore Night Festival at Bugis Street.

What’s more, shop and earn eCapitaVoucher, free brand experiences, and exclusive deals from your favourite stores!

Find out more on their website here.

 

About Bugis Town

Bugis Junction, Bugis+ & Bugis Street collectively form Bugis Town – a vibrant lifestyle destination packed with endless food offerings, affordable luxuries, trendiest looks and fun entertainment, all set in the heart of the culture-rich Bugis precinct.

Items.Title: Dandelion
Items.Content:
Dandelion is an immersive light installation that explores the poetic intersection between humanity and technology. Composed of 3000 fibre optic strands and motion-sensitive sensors, the sculpture responds organically to human presence, glowing and shifting in a mesmerising dance of light.

Inspired by its namesake, Dandelion captures the ethereal beauty of seeds scattered by the wind, just like NAFA students who take flight from Singapore to flourish across the world. As the installation transforms with each interaction, it whispers a quiet invitation: “Dare to dance like a dandelion in the wind”, calling upon the audience to move with hope, lightness, and fearless possibility.

 

About Nanyang Academy of Fine Arts (NAFA)
Established in 1938, the Nanyang Academy of Fine Arts (NAFA), University of the Arts Singapore is Singapore’s pioneer arts education institution, well-known for grooming diverse artistic talent. Through research-based practice and experiential learning, NAFA nurtures creative talents and changemakers, highly skilled, and well-rounded in interdisciplinary approaches who impact diverse arts and creative fields in Singapore and abroad. NAFA has nurtured the most number of alumni conferred the nation’s highest accolades, with 16 Cultural Medallion and 15 Young Artist Award recipients. 

Click here to find out more about NAFA.

Items.Content:
Visitors of all ages can enjoy a lively mix of drop-in craft and heritage-inspired activities designed to spark curiosity and creativity. Join us for hands-on craft activities, including planting your own plant pots, building your own 3D models of Fort Canning’s iconic 9-pound cannon, making your own spice cards, and colouring activity sheets!

About Fort Canning Park

Fort Canning Park – a historic and iconic green space in the heart of Singapore. Once the site of ancient royalty, now offers lush greenery, heritage trials and historical landmarks.

Items.Title: Festival at the Fort 2025: Whispers of an Island
Items.Content:
Whispers of an Island invites you on an enchanting 15-minute journey where the ancient trees of Fort Canning Park become your guides through centuries of history. Follow their stories as stunning projections transform the foliage around you, revealing how this hill has witnessed Singapore's metamorphosis from the spice trade of yesteryears to the visionary tale of Singapore today. Don't miss this captivating blend of technology and storytelling that brings the Fort's past to life beneath the canopy of its oldest inhabitants.

About Fort Canning Park

Fort Canning Park – a historic and iconic green space in the heart of Singapore. Once the site of ancient royalty, now offers lush greenery, heritage trials and historical landmarks.

Items.Title: HueManity: When Eyes Meet One Island
Items.Content:
Huemanity invites you to see Singapore through new lenses—where red fades into deep blue waters, light reveals and conceals, and the world shifts depending on who's looking. Set across three windows on Bencoolen Street, the installation layers illustrations of local folklore, marine life, and the role of colour in our society. Using chromatic filters and modified light, it explores how context colours perception. By rethinking how and what we see, Huemanity invites reflection on the many viewpoints that shape the shared Singaporean experience that is dynamic and ever-changing.

Items.Title: Island Nights – Singapore Night Festival @ Children’s Museum Singapore Open House
Items.Content:
This Singapore Night Festival, immerse yourself in the vibrant buzz of Island Nights at Children’s Museum Singapore's highly anticipated annual open house. For this special event, grown-ups without children are invited to enter the museum after regular hours.

Step into two full floors of captivating immersive exhibits and enjoy playful, interactive experiences designed to spark joy and wonder after dark.

This is a rare opportunity to explore the museum's engaging spaces in a relaxed, adult-friendly atmosphere, offering a fresh perspective on its creative displays. Come and have some fun while relishing in a nostalgic and imaginative evening at the heart of the festival.

About Children's Museum Singapore
Let’s “Start with Wonder” at Children’s Museum Singapore. Children’s Museum Singapore is the first museum in Singapore dedicated to children 12 years old and below. It serves as a ‘starter museum’ to introduce young visitors and their families to the museum-going experience and facilitate a conducive environment for learning through play.

Items.Title: Light on the Hill - Island Celebrations
Items.Content:
Wesley Methodist Church presents “Light on the Hill: Island Celebrations” to commemorate SG60 and its 140th anniversary.

Experience the kampong spirit of early settlers living in huts by the sea sharing their harvests. Explore the island’s oldest Methodist church and be serenaded by uplifting choral music at the sanctuary. Sing, dance and play under the moonlight with ukulele performances and origami fun art for all ages. Capture picture perfect moments at the photo booths with tropical island themed sets, costumes, props and fascinating augmented reality filters. All activities are free for everyone to enjoy and celebrate this enchanting island everyone loves.

 

About Wesley Methodist Church

Wesley Methodist Church, the oldest and largest Methodist church in Singapore, has a rich heritage dating back to 1885. Nestled at Fort Canning, we are a vibrant Christian community offering diverse programs and events, and various worship experiences, including Traditional, Contemporary Prayer & Praise, Youth, Mandarin, and Filipino services. As we celebrate our 140th Anniversary, we continue to look up to God’s faithfulness and reach out in our mission.

Click here to check out our programmes for Singapore Night Festival 2025.

Items.Title: Nila’s Shimmering Shores – An Immersive Story Room Adventure
Items.Content:
Step into the heart of Island Nights at the Singapore Night Festival with this exclusive ticketed sensory experience.

As dusk descends, embark on a captivating journey to a shimmering island where the sea whispers ancient secrets and timeless legends emerge.

Check out Story Room Adventure, a reimagined tale of Sang Nila Utama, meticulously designed as an inclusive immersive experience for neurodiverse children. Through a rich blend of sound, texture, movement, and interactive play, both children and adults will encounter iconic elements like the golden deer, the majestic lion, and the formidable storm that started it all.

This magical encounter seamlessly blends storytelling, innovative installation art, and engaging craft, inviting everyone to explore, imagine, and rediscover a shared sense of wonder beneath the enchanting glow of the Island Nights.

Items.Title: The Listening Biennial, Third-Edition
Items.Content:
The third edition of The Listening Biennial extends a profound invitation to engage with the humming stars above and the myriad voices they carry. These voices articulate themes of love and loss, simultaneously preserving the past while actively evoking possibilities for the future. They resonate with an inherent mystery and formidable force, intricately weaving together cosmic matter and embodied life with their potent stories.

As a highlight of the Singapore Night Festival, the artists behind The Listening Biennial encourage visitors to step into the space of Third Listening. Here, the focus shifts to actively listening for a plurality of diverse life-forms and discovering pathways of interconnection amidst seemingly irreconcilable differences, fostering a deeper understanding of our shared existence amidst a bold soundscape.

Find out more about the Listening Biennial here

Social Media
IG: @listeningbiennialsg @listeningbiennial

Items.Title: The Puppet Stage: Handcrafted Stories
Items.Content:
Step into the world of Chinese glove puppetry, a traditional art form where stories come to life, right at your fingertips.

This display showcases intricately crafted glove puppets used in performances that were once popular in community spaces in the 20th century. With their vivid expressions, elaborate costumes and skilful movements, these puppets were more than entertainment – they represented folklore, values, religious significance and cultural identity across generations. Today, they are enduring symbols of craftsmanship, storytelling and Singapore’s rich heritage.

The installation is co-presented by the National Library Board and HeritageSG. NLB hopes to inspire the discovery of hidden stories and facets of Singapore’s past from the collections of the National Library and the National Archives of Singapore.

Discover more at go.gov.sg/atsg2025.

Venue.Value: Atrium, Level 3, National Archives of Singapore
Venue.Address: Atrium, Level 3, National Archives of Singapore

Items.Title: Undisclosed Tours: Island Nights Edition
Items.Content:
Discover the Bras Basah.Bugis (BBB) precinct anew through the Undisclosed Island Nights Edition Tour, a curated journey that unveils the hidden narratives and lesser-known pathways of the Singapore Night Festival (SNF). This exclusive experience offers a fresh perspective on the festival’s artworks and installations, thoughtfully guided by our dedicated SNF volunteers — the “Night Owls.”

What sets this tour apart? The itinerary remains a mystery until the moment you gather. Each route is a carefully designed exploration into the unexpected, inviting you to embrace spontaneity and see the city in a new light.

An evening of quiet discovery and artful wonder awaits — if you’re willing to let the night lead the way.

Details

Friday | 22 Aug, 29 Aug, & 5 Sep 2025

Saturday | 23 Aug, 30 Aug, & 6 Sep 2025

 

Time slot 1: 8pm - 9pm

Time slot 2: 8.30pm - 9.30pm

Tickets: Free with Registration.


What to bring

  • Water to stay hydrated
  • Comfortable clothing and shoes to walk in
  • Your mobile phone AND compatible audio device
  • Yourself!

Audience Suitability

  • Suitable for families, youth, educators, and cultural enthusiasts
  • Tours will be conducted in English

Additional Info

  • Speakers/hearing devices will not be provided, instead, download the LiveVoice app on your mobile phones to receive on-site live audio transmission from our guides!
  • Maximum number of participants per session: 20

Items.Title: Waterloo Street Stories by #WaterlooStKakis
Items.Content:
Waterloo Street Stories by #WaterlooStKakis is a multidisciplinary project celebrating Waterloo Street’s cultural richness: from religious landmarks to arts spaces and everyday life. Through a diverse array of mediums including photography, live performances, audio plays, interactive workshops, and screenings, the project dives into Singapore’s maritime roots and its continuously evolving identity. Coordinated by The Theatre Practice and programmed by Centre 42, Objectifs, P7:1SMA, and SMU-ACM, it meticulously maps Waterloo Street's layered histories through movement, sensory experiences, and community engagement. By transforming the street into a dreamscape of shared memories, it invites reflection on connection, heritage, and place, seamlessly blurring past and present in a vibrant celebration of urban life.


Programmes

Objectifs

About Waterloo Street Kakis

The Theatre Practice (Practice) is Singapore’s longest-standing professional bilingual theatre institution. Artist-driven and deeply progressive, Practice strives to be an arts space in Singapore that consciously nurtures and empowers people who care about humanity. Over the past 58 years, we have developed and presented works that aim to reflect the richness and complexities of Singapore’s diverse cultures. Artistically diverse and constantly relevant, Practice will always engage in the ceaseless exploration of new frontiers. 

Objectifs is a visual arts space in Singapore that is dedicated to film and photography. Our goal is to cultivate original voices in visual storytelling, and to inspire and broaden perspectives through the power of images. We do this by presenting a year round programme of exhibitions, screenings, workshops, talks, mentorships and residencies, aimed at fostering dialogue about visual culture, and advancing the practice and appreciation of photography and film. 

P7:1SMA, also referred to as Prisma, is a dance performance company helmed by Norhaizad Adam. Our core ethos revolves around the belief that "Dance is a strategy, and Malay is a concept." Through our creative endeavors, we navigate the intricate blend of tradition and contemporary practices. Our mission is twofold: to delve into moral complexities and to push the boundaries of tradition. At the heart of our approach lies a commitment to respect and reciprocity. By confronting moral dilemmas head-on, we aim to challenge entrenched traditions, fostering a space where new understandings can flourish. Through our innovative works, we seek to reshape perceptions of Malay culture and identity, inviting audiences to explore new realms of thought and appreciation. 

Centre 42 is a theatre development space committed to the creation, documentation and promotion of Singapore theatre, particularly in text-based works. We incubate original writings for the stage, support the development of artists and new works, and manage a functional archive documenting the histories and processes of Singapore theatre. Centre 42 is located at 42 Waterloo Street, and has called the Blue House its home since 2014. 2024 marks 10 years of Centre 42’s contribution to this street.

The Arts and Culture Management Programme at Singapore Management University (SMU-ACM) is a second major that provides an interdisciplinary blend of conceptual and skills-based learning to equip students with the foundational knowledge, managerial aptitude and strategic reflexivity for entry into the arts and creative industries. The hallmark strengths of ACM are the close linkages to the arts and cultural policy communities in Southeast Asia, and focus on experiential industry projects intended to sharpen the professional competencies and cultural leadership potential of students.

Items.Title: Waterloo Street Stories: A Sun-Dried Time Capsule
Items.Content:
Outdoor Photo Exhibition

Dates: Fri, 22 Aug - Sat, 6 Sep 2025
Time: Tues - Thurs: 12pm - 7pm | Fri - Sat: 12pm - 9pm | Sun: 12pm - 4pm (Closed on Mondays)
Venue: Objectifs Courtyard

Collage & Mark-Making Workshop

Date: Sat, 30 Aug 2025
Time: 7pm – 10pm
Venue: Objectifs Annexe
Admission: Free admission, no registration required

 

Objectifs presents an outdoor exhibition by emerging visual artist Angelena Ikah, during the Singapore Night Festival 2025. Her work is the culmination of a two-month residency at Objectifs.

A Sun-Dried Time Capsule is a reflection on the enduring charm of Waterloo Street and its stretch of sun-dry shops known for their dried produce and herbs. These goods resemble time capsules, with traces of history preserved in their shriveled skins and faded hues, shaped slowly by time, sunlight, and care. This series explores the imprint of time on form, space, and human connection; created using silver gelatin printing, each image is shaped by its reaction to different materials, durations, and sunlight exposures. It is both a quiet observation and a tribute to the sun-dried shops of Waterloo Street, and to the subtle forms that emerge when time, environment, and attentiveness converge.

Formerly from the Objectifs Young Photographers’ Mentorship Programme, Angelena will also conduct a workshop on Collage & Mark-Making. In this workshop, she invites participants to turn the every day into the extraordinary, blending the art of collage with the playful technique of mark-making to transform a simple envelope into a personal time capsule.

Participants will work with a curated set of images to craft a layered visual story, then experiment with natural, sun-dried materials to stamp and press unique textures onto their piece. Walk away with a one-of-a-kind keepsake that captures memories, moments, and a bit of magic.

Suitable for all ages and skill levels. Materials will be provided.

 

Now Showing: Where There’s Water

An outdoor short film programme presented by Objectifs in collaboration with Japanese film collective GINZAZA

Date: Fri, 5 Sep 2025
Time: 7.30pm – 9.30pm
Venue: Platform, Objectifs
Admission: Entry by donation – suggested donation $10 – $15 per pax.

 

Concurrent with the programmes, Objectifs’ next edition of Now Showing. Themed around water, the programme highlights the artistic, playful, and expressive form of short films curated by visionary Japanese film collective GINZAZA. Expect to be immersed in stories that ripple beneath the surface and linger long after the screen fades to black. Following the screening, dive right into the post-screening creative activity and experiment with the art of water marbling – a tactile craft that echoes the themes of fluidity, reflection, and transformation explored in Where There’s Water. Using images from the films, participants can craft patterns on paper using tools like sticks to create a one-of-a-kind artwork, bringing home a physical reminder of the themes from the film programme.

Find out more and RSVP here

Items.Title: Waterloo Street Stories: Familiar Strangers
Items.Content:
An arts-led, community-engaged project about the embedded ecologies and intangible cultural heritage of the denizens of Waterloo Street. Amidst today’s climate of constant change and redevelopment, this project aims to bring to light to older and quieter neighbourhoods like Waterloo Street. In particular, this project aims to capture and celebrate the stories, interrelations and cultural heritage of the varied inhabitants who call Waterloo Street home. This project also hopes to inspire those less familiar with Waterloo Street to contemplate about the strangers in their own lives, and connect with the concept of a ‘familiar stranger’, a stranger who one nonetheless recognises from regular, sustained contact despite not forming a personal relationship.

 

a) ⁠Outdoor Photo Exhibition

Dates: Wed, 20 Aug to Sun, 7 Sep 2025
Venue: Back courtyard of Stamford Arts Centre

Set along the locale of Waterloo Street, this exhibition of staged self-portraits traces the residual presence of a city. During nightfall, the artist photographs himself as a speculative mid-century familiar stranger. The city becomes palimpsest, each image drawing the past into view through quiet acts of embodiment. Moving between visibility and disappearance, the work dwells where memory resists the forward march of development. It questions how a place holds its history, and how that history might be conjured—if only for a moment—before vanishing again.

 

b) Interactive Programme

Dates: Fri, 22 Aug & Sat, 23 Aug | Sat, 30 Aug & Sun, 31 Aug | Fri, 5 Sep & Sat, 6 Sep
Time: 6pm – 10.30pm
Venue: Stamford Arts Centre L1 Project Studio 

Familiar Strangers is a participatory arts programme exploring the subtle and often overlooked fabric of social connections in our everyday lives. Through the showcasing of the myriad lived experiences of urban sociality embodied within Waterloo Street, a self-guided activity invites everyone to recall the familiar strangers in our lives – individuals we recognise but do not know – and co-create a community installation comprising a mosaic of stories that celebrates the significance of fleeting interactions in our lives. By encouraging dialogue and self-reflection, Familiar Strangers encourages participants to cultivate a heightened appreciation for, and curiosity about, the lives and perspectives of others around us.

 

 

About SMU-ACM

The Arts and Culture Management Programme at Singapore Management University (SMU-ACM) is a second major that provides an interdisciplinary blend of conceptual and skills-based learning to equip students with the foundational knowledge, managerial aptitude and strategic reflexivity for entry into the arts and creative industries. The hallmark strengths of ACM are the close linkages to the arts and cultural policy communities in Southeast Asia, and focus on experiential industry projects intended to sharpen the professional competencies and cultural leadership potential of students.

Items.Title: Waterloo Street Stories: Sound Plot Audio Plays Series
Items.Content:
Centre 42 started its audio play presentation with the 2023 edition of the Singapore Night Festival, as part of the inaugural Waterloo Street Stories by the #WaterlooStKakis collective. Since then, C42’s Sound Plot audio plays series have grown to include new audio dramas each year, as creative responses to different sites in Singapore:
Bras Basah Bugis / Central, 2023
Southern-most (Tanjong Pagar district), 2024
West (Jurong), 2025

For Singapore Night Festival 2025, C42 will bring together all 10 produced plays in an on-site installation of listening experiences. This programme will also feature a newly commissioned audio play responding to SNF2025’s theme on “Island Nights”. This curatorial theme will see C42’s Writer-in-Residence exploring Singapore’s archipelagic relationship and histories as an island in South East Asia.

The installation is planned to take place across all three weekends of SNF, subject to space availability and coordination with the performance schedules at 42 Waterloo Street.

Items.Title: The Latex Lobby
Items.Content:
Rubber is a common material rarely given a second thought in our daily lives. It is elastic, resilient and waterproof and used for essential everyday products such as tyres, gloves and boots. Rubber has revolutionised the way we live yet few may know that Singapore once played a pivotal role in the development of this billion-dollar industry during the late 19th and 20th centuries. Brought in by the British empire, this South American native tree eventually evolved into a major cash crop.

A chimeric surrealist assemblage of ceramic, botanical material, photography and shadow play – this installation references and reimagines, in a modern-day context, various aspects of the often-overlooked history of rubber plantations in Singapore. Inspired by the herringbone rubber tapping technique refined by Henry Nicholas Ridley (the first director of the Singapore Botanic Gardens), this work invites the curious visitor to peer into the diagonal slits to discover the sights and textures of the forgotten rubber industry, against quotidian rubber objects that populate our daily lives.

About the artists
Working in the mediums of photography, ceramics, and botanical design respectively, Isabell Hansen, Hans Chew, and Fawn World aim to work at the intersection of these disciplines. Led by curiosity, their joint experimentation is driven less by finding answers, and more by asking questions. Through visual storytelling, tactile inquiries, and spotlighting the overlooked, they invite closer looking and hope to encourage new ways of seeing.

Discover more at go.gov.sg/atsg2025.
Items.Artist: Isabell Hansen, Hans Chew, and Fawn World

Items.Title: Singapore Night Festival @ St. Joseph's Church - An Island's Guiding Beacon of Faith
Items.Content:
Step into a night of luminous history and heavenly music at St Joseph’s Church VS: An Island’s Guiding Beacon of Faith. 

Discover the legacy of its pioneering missionaries through an immersive tour. Let the glow of stained glass and the harmonies of live music transport you to a realm of serenity and wonder. Register now for a guided tour and bask in enchanting music performances. Experience faith, history, and artistry under the island’s starlit embrace. 

About St. Joseph's Church

St. Joseph’s Church VS, founded by the Portuguese Mission in 1853, served Catholics of Portuguese and Malacca Eurasian heritage. It remained under the Bishop of Macau’s jurisdiction until 1981, when it became a church of devotion under Singapore’s Archdiocese. Completed in 1912, its neo-Gothic design features an octagonal belfry, azulejo tiles, and stained-glass windows. Gazetted as a national monument in 2005, it underwent major restoration and opened in 2022.

Located at the heart of the city, the Cathedral of the Good Shepherd is Singapore’s oldest Roman Catholic church and the seat of our local Archbishop. Built in 1847, it stands as a sacred place of worship and a testament to the faith and sacrifice of the early missionaries who journeyed from afar to plant the seeds of Catholicism in Singapore.

Items.Title: Waterloo Street Stories: Fortune Hands
Items.Content:
In Fortune Hands, performers bring to life stories of history, faith, and fortune, honouring the vibrant maritime and trade roots that shaped Singapore. Hands—symbols of connection, labour, and exchange—reflect the nation’s identity as a bustling port city, where ships were built, deals were struck, and strangers became friends. But these hands don’t just belong to the past—they remain part of everyday life. Along Waterloo Street, palm readers study open palms, offering quiet insight and a moment of reflection in a fast-moving world.

 

About P7:1SMA

P7:1SMA, also referred to as Prisma, is a dance performance company helmed by Norhaizad Adam. Our core ethos revolves around the belief that "Dance is a strategy, and Malay is a concept." Through our creative endeavours, we navigate the intricate blend of tradition and contemporary practices. Our mission is twofold: to delve into moral complexities and to push the boundaries of tradition. At the heart of our approach lies a commitment to respect and reciprocity. By confronting moral dilemmas head-on, we aim to challenge entrenched traditions, fostering a space where new understandings can flourish. Through our innovative works, we seek to reshape perceptions of Malay culture and identity, inviting audiences to explore new realms of thought and appreciation.

Welcome to a magical space where cultures bloom and creativity flows. Dress in your best island wear and experience Singapore's vibrant island spirit through enchanting encounters and shared stories. Inspired by objects and motifs from the Peranakan Museum, this hidden paradise comes to life through contemporary art, conversations, and collaboration. Come explore and imagine with us.

Extended Museum Hours: (7pm - 11pm)

  • Saturday: 23, 30 Aug & 6 Sep

About Peranakan Museum
Peranakan Museum presents the cross-cultural art of Peranakan communities in Southeast Asia. Installed in the former Tao Nan School, built in 1912, it holds one of the world’s finest public collections of Peranakan objects. Three floors explore Peranakan life through themes related to origins, home, and style as aspects of identity. Community interviews, recorded demonstrations, art commissions, and other contemporary expressions of Peranakan culture provide a multi-faceted experience for visitors, encouraging them to ask themselves: "what is Peranakan?".

The museum is a department of ACM, operating under the National Heritage Board.

Items.Title: Immerse in an Exclusive Spa Journey
Items.Content:
Island nights call for a little pampering. Undertake a luxurious spa journey with our Multi-Award-Winning Treatment in our Signature Salt Room at $85:

  • 60-min Signature Salt Room Bespoke Facial
  • 60-min Signature Salt Room Bespoke Back Facial (worth up to $390)

Promotion valid till 31 October 2025. Please book your pampering moment online at pabloblau.com/rcfp or quote RCFP when you call our spa concierge at 6261 6885. The facial is valid for both female and male customers. The back facial is valid for female customers only. The promotion is valid for first-time customers and customers who have not visited Pablo Blau in the last 12 months, aged 21 and above. Promotion is non-refundable, not exchangeable for cash or product, and is not in conjunction with other promotions, offers and discounts. The management reserves the right to vary the terms and conditions without prior notice.

 

About Pablo Blau

Pablo Blau is Singapore’s first luxury spa offering exclusive skin treatments in salt rooms inspired by Europe’s famous salt mines. These rooms are coated with pharmaceutical-grade dry salt crystals. The facials improve skin health, while the salt environment enhances anti-aging, boosts immunity, prevents colds and flu, and improves sleep. In just 45 minutes, our Signature Salt Rooms deliver results equal to three hours in a natural salt cave.

Items.Title: Singapore Night Festival Staycation Package: Glow & Stay at ibis Bencoolen
Items.Content:
Be right next to the action happening at the Singapore Night Festival with our Glow & Stay Staycation Package at ibis Singapore on Bencoolen.

Enjoy a 1-night stay in a cosy Superior Room with international breakfast buffet for 2, plus 15% off food and drinks at TASTE Restaurant and LeBar — including Singapore Night Festival-themed specials. Unwind after the festivities with a complimentary late check-out at 4pm (subject to availability).

Just steps from the action, it’s the perfect urban getaway to soak in the glow, flavours, and music of the festival weekend. Book now and stay in the heart of the city’s most vibrant celebration.

Bookable from 14 July 2025 for stays between festival period: 22 Aug to 6 Sep 2025

 About ibis Singapore on Bencoolen

ibis Singapore on Bencoolen – Award-Winning Comfort in the Heart of Singapore

Located in the vibrant Bugis district, ibis Singapore on Bencoolen offers a seamless blend of comfort, convenience, and sustainability. Enjoy newly refurbished rooms, high-speed Wi-Fi, and eco-friendly amenities. With excellent connectivity to MRT stations and top attractions, plus 24/7 dining options, our award-winning hotel is the perfect choice for business and leisure travellers seeking affordability without compromise.

Items.Title: Island-inspired Snacks and Craft Beer at The Stamford Brasserie
Items.Content:
Delight in island-inspired flavours at The Stamford Brasserie, available for dine-in or takeaway.

From savoury snacks to bold local favourites, each dish offers a taste of the tropics. Complete your experience by pairing your meal with refreshing craft beers on tap.

Prices start from $16++

 

About The Stamford Brasserie

Step into a world of gastronomic delights at The Stamford Brasserie, an all-day dining in Singapore that brings to life the charm and exuberance of a classic French bistro. 

The stylish tri-concept outlet, first in the hotel to run completely plastic-free, features a Grab & Go and bistro menu by Chef Thogin, complemented by artisanal beverages and craft beers on tap.

Click here to find out more about The Stamford Brasserie.

Items.Title: Island Ember
Items.Content:
Light up island nights with Island Ember, an exclusive promotion at the Tai Cheong Raffles City outlet. Best known for their iconic egg tarts and traditional Hong Kong-style bakes, they're putting a local twist on heritage flavours. Island Embers is their heartfelt invitation to you, infusing nostalgic treats with a spark of Singapore spirit, inspired by Singapore's warmth and energy.

Enjoy Raffles City's exclusive fiery deal: 2 charcoal egg tarts for $5 (U.P. $6). Available for a limited time only.

 

About Tai Cheong Bakery

Tai Cheong Bakery is a beloved Hong Kong brand with roots dating back to 1954, proudly serving in Singapore since 2016. Known for its signature egg tarts and nostalgic bakes, Tai Cheong blends heritage with local flair.
